thread.title: Darrelle Revis turns himself in to Pittsburgh police
thread.title_full: Darrelle Revis turns himself in to Pittsburgh police | New York Post

author: Post Sports Desk
title: Darrelle Revis turns himself in to Pittsburgh police
text:
Darrelle Revis responded Friday night to the warrant issued for his arrest a day earlier, showing up to the Pittsburgh police department to turn himself in to authorities.
The Jets’ veteran cornerback was hit with four charges Thursday night – aggravated assault, robbery, terrorist threats and conspiracy – for his involvement in a street fight in Pittsburgh early Sunday morning. Revis allegedly is responsible for knocking two men unconscious after an argument escalated over a cellphone video recording.
According to a criminal complaint document obtained Friday , Revis also threatened one man by asking , “Do you want to be next?” He then warned him, “I’ve got more guys coming.”
Revis, 31, was in the area visiting family over the weekend, according to attorney Blaine Jones. Jones remains adamant Revis was not the aggressor in the incident and any punches he threw were in self-defense.
